meanings.definition: To have more physical strength than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the arm-wrestling match, John easily outmuscles his opponent.
meanings.sent2: In the weightlifting competition, Sarah outmuscles all her competitors.
meanings.sent3: The little ant outmuscles the big beetle in a strength contest.
meanings.sent4: The powerful waves outmuscle the small boat, tossing it around like a toy.
meanings.sent5: The superhero outmuscles the villain, saving the city from destruction.

meanings.definition: To overpower or defeat someone in a physical competition.
meanings.sent1: In the wrestling match, Jack outmuscles his opponent with a swift move.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer outmuscles every challenger who steps into the ring.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse outmuscles the cat in a playful game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The determined runner outmuscles fatigue to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The skilled martial artist outmuscles his opponent with precise strikes.
